description: The tmnxVrrpIPListMismatch trap is generated when the IP address
list received in the advertisement messages received from the
current master did not match the configured IP address list.
This is an edge triggered notification. A second trap will not
be generated for a packet from the same master until this event
has been cleared.
The value for tmnxVrrpRouterMasterIPListMatch specifies whether or not
the IP address list in the advertisement messages received from
the master matched the configured virtual router IP address list.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tmnxVrrpRouterMasterIPListMatch

description: The tmnxVrrpIPListMismatchClear trap is generated when a previously
ocurring tmnxVrrpIPListMismatch trap has been cleared because
the IP address list in the advertisement messages received from
the current master now matches the configured IP address list.
This is an edge triggered notification. A second trap will not
be generated for a packet from the same master until this event
has been set again.
The value for tmnxVrrpRouterMasterIPListMatch specifies whether or not
the IP address list in the advertisement messages received from
the master matched the configured virtual router IP address list.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tmnxVrrpRouterMasterIPListMatch

description: The tmnxVrrpMultipleOwners trap is generated when a VRRP virtual
router instance that has been configured as an owner notices that
that another VRRP instance is also advertising itself as an owner.
The value for tmnxVrrpRouterMasterLastSeen specifies the sysUpTime
when the master was last seen by this virtual router instance. In
other words it is the timestamp of the last advertisement message
that was received from that master.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tmnxVrrpRouterMasterLastSeen

description: The tmnxVrrpBecameBackup trap is generated when the sending
agent has transitioned to 'Backup' state.
The master router's real (primary) IP address. This is
the IP address listed as the source in VRRP advertisement
last received by this virtual router.
variables.name: VRRP-MIB::vrrpOperMasterIpAddr

description: The notification tmnxVrrpBfdIntfSessStateChgd is generated when the
operational state of BFD session of the VRRP instance changes.

event.Summary: VRRP instance BFD session state changed to $v5

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tmnxVrrpBfdIntfSessStateChgd TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tmnxVrrpNotifBfdIntfSvcId u 9999 TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tmnxVrrpNotifBfdIntfIfName s EXAMPLE TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tmnxVrrpNotifBfdIntfDestIpType i 0 TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tmnxVrrpNotifBfdIntfDestIp s EXAM TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tmnxVrrpNotifBfdIntfSessState i 1

description: The value of tmnxVrrpNotifBfdIntfSvcId specifies the service
ID of the interface running BFD in the notification.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tmnxVrrpNotifBfdIntfSvcId

description: The value of tmnxVrrpNotifBfdIntfIfName specifies the name of the
interface running BFD in the notification.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tmnxVrrpNotifBfdIntfIfName

description: The value of tmnxVrrpNotifBfdIntfDestIpType specifies the address type
of tmnxVrrpNotifBfdIntfDestIp object.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tmnxVrrpNotifBfdIntfDestIpType

description: The value of tmnxVrrpNotifBfdIntfDestIp specifies the destination
IP address on the interface running BFD in the notification.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tmnxVrrpNotifBfdIntfDestIp

description: The value of tmnxVrrpNotifBfdIntfSessState indicates the operational
state of BFD session on the interface in the notification.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tmnxVrrpNotifBfdIntfSessState

description: The tmnxVrrpBecameBackup trap is generated when the sending
agent has transitioned to 'Backup' state.
The master router's real IP address. Master router
would set this address to vrrpOperationsPrimaryIpAddr
while transitioning to master state. For backup
routers, this is the IP address listed as the source in
VRRP advertisement last received by this virtual
router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRRP-V3-MIB::vrrpOperationsMasterIpAddr

description: The tVrrpTrapNewMaster trap indicates that the sending agent
has transitioned to 'Master' state.

event.Summary: VRRP transitioned to master state due to $v2

description: The master router's real IP address. Master router
would set this address to vrrpOperationsPrimaryIpAddr
while transitioning to master state. For backup
routers, this is the IP address listed as the source in
VRRP advertisement last received by this virtual
router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRRP-V3-MIB::vrrpOperationsMasterIpAddr

description: This indicates the reason for tVrrpTrapNewMaster trap.
Used by tVrrpTrapNewMaster trap. The object can be
polled if the tVrrpTrapNewMaster trap is lost to identify
the reason for transmission. Backup router should
return notmaster(0) when pooled.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRRP-V3-MIB::vrrpNewMasterReason

description: The tVrrpIPListMismatch trap is generated when the IPv6 address
list received in the advertisement messages received from the
current master did not match the configured IPv6 address list.
This is an edge triggered notification. A second trap will not
be generated for a packet from the same master until this event
has been cleared.
The value for tVrrpRtrMasterIPListMatch indicates whether or not
the IP address list in the advertisement messages received from
the master matched the configured virtual router IP address list.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tVrrpRtrMasterIPListMatch

description: The tVrrpIPListMismatchClear trap is generated when a previously
ocurring tVrrpIPListMismatch trap has been cleared because
the IPv6 address list in the advertisement messages received from
the current master now matches the configured IPv6 address list.
This is an edge triggered notification. A second trap will not
be generated for a packet from the same master until this event
has been set again.
The value for tVrrpRtrMasterIPListMatch indicates whether or not
the IP address list in the advertisement messages received from
the master matched the configured virtual router IP address list.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tVrrpRtrMasterIPListMatch

description: The tVrrpMultipleOwners trap is generated when a VRRP virtual
router instance that has been configured as an owner notices that
that another VRRP instance is also advertising itself as an owner.
The value for tVrrpRtrMasterLastSeen indicates the sysUpTime
when the master was last seen by this virtual router instance. In
other words it is the timestamp of the last advertisement message
that was received from that master.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tVrrpRtrMasterLastSeen

description: The tVrrpRouterAdvNotActivated trap is generated when the parent
interface of the IPv6 virtual router instance is either not set
to send out Router Advertisement or the Router Advertisement is
not configured to use the virtual MAC address. The virtual router
instance is not allowed to become operationally 'up'.
The value of tVrrpOpState indicates the operational state
of the VRRP virtual router instance.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tVrrpOpState

description: The tVrrpRouterAdvNotActivatedClear trap is generated when a
previously occurring tVrrpRouterAdvNotActivated trap has been cleared.
The tVrrpRouterAdvNotActivatedClear trap is generated when either:
- the parent interface of the IPv6 virtual router instance is set to
send out Router Advertisement, and Router Advertisement is
configured to user virtual MAC, or
- the virtual router instance is no longer attempting to become active
(e.g. the virtual-router is administratively shutdown).
The value of tVrrpOpState indicates the operational state
of the VRRP virtual router instance.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRRP-MIB::tVrrpOpState
